channel.title: Annoying Errors
channel.description:
[code] client.java:168: non-static variable players cannot be referenced from a static context "Trading With: " + PlayerHandler.players[tradeWith].playerName, ^ client.java:284: non-static variable players cannot be referenced from a static context PlayerHandler.players[tradeWith].playerOTItems[fromSlot] = 0; ^ client.java:287: non-static variable players cannot be referenced from a static context PlayerHandler.players[tradeWith].playerOTItemsN[fromSlot] -= amount;
^ client.java:290: non-static variable players cannot be referenced from a static context PlayerHandler.players[tradeWith].tradeUpdateOther = true; ^ client.java:291: non-static variable players cannot be referenced from a static context if (PlayerHandler.players[tradeWith].tradeStatus == 3) { ^ client.java:292: non-static variable players cannot be referenced from a static context PlayerHandler.players[tradeWith].tradeStatus = 2; ^ client.java:293: non-static variable players cannot be referenced from a static context PlayerHandler.players[tradeWith].AntiTradeScam = true; ^ client.java:303: non-static variable players cannot be referenced from a static context if (PlayerHandler.players[tradeWith] == null) { ^ client.java:325: non-static variable players cannot be referenced from a static context PlayerHandler.players[tradeWith].playerOTItemsN[i] += am ount; ^ client.java:336: non-static variable players cannot be referenced from a static context PlayerHandler.players[tradeWith].playerOTItems[i] = play erItems[fromSlot]; ^ client.java:337: non-static variable players cannot be referenced from a static context PlayerHandler.players[tradeWith].playerOTItemsN[i] = amo unt; ^ client.java:348: non-static variable players cannot be referenced from a static context PlayerHandler.players[tradeWith].tradeUpdateOther = true; ^ client.java:349: non-static variable players cannot be referenced from a static context if (PlayerHandler.players[tradeWith].tradeStatus == 3) { ^ client.java:350: non-static variable players cannot be referenced from a static context PlayerHandler.players[tradeWith].tradeStatus = 2; ^ client.java:351: non-static variable players cannot be referenced from a static context PlayerHandler.players[tradeWith].AntiTradeScam = true; ^ client.java:1394: non-static variable players cannot be referenced from a static context if (PlayerHandler.players[i] != null) { ^ client.java:1395: non-static variable players cannot be referenced from a static context if (PlayerHandler.players[i].IsShopping == true ^ client.java:1396: non-static variable players cannot be referenced from a static context && PlayerHandler.players[i].MyShopID == MyShopID ^ client.java:1398: non-static variable players cannot be referenced from a static context PlayerHandler.players[i].UpdateShop = true; ^ ^ client.java:2681: non-static variable players cannot be referenced from a static context PlayerHandler.players[tradeWith].tradeOtherDeclined = true; ^ Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. 20 errors Press any key to continue . . . [/code]
Well i was adding Trading to my new server. and this happened :confused:
Anyhelp would be helpful

item.title: Annoying Errors
item.dc:creator: @surfer25 surfer25
item.description:
@surfer25 wrote:

[quote=“Yz85Racer, post:6, topic:170058”]players does not have the static modifier. Change Where you call it directly, and call it through an instance, e.g
Replace PlayerHandler.players
With, server.playerHandler.players
To all of them[/quote]

I think i’m in love you you…
haha thanks

Read full topic

item.title: Annoying Errors
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

players does not have the static modifier. Change where you call it directly, and call it through an instance, e.g
Replace PlayerHandler.players
With, server.playerHandler.players
To all of them

Read full topic

item.title: Annoying Errors
item.dc:creator: @surfer25 surfer25
item.description:
@surfer25 wrote:

delta:

Wrong, he would get 100 errors if he put a bracket in the wrong place, and where else did you add things?

I added Code to Client.java and Player.java

Read full topic

item.title: Annoying Errors
item.dc:creator: @webbsta webbsta
item.description:
@webbsta wrote:

i said SUCH AS, a.k.a something small like mis-placing a bracket… i didn’t say that was it ffs

Read full topic

item.title: Annoying Errors
item.dc:creator: @delta delta
item.description:
@delta wrote:

Wrong, he would get 100 errors if he put a bracket in the wrong place, and where else did you add things?

Read full topic

item.title: Annoying Errors
item.dc:creator: @webbsta webbsta
item.description:
@webbsta wrote:

remove all the code you added, you probably made a very small error such as not placing a bracket back in the right place. so remove all the code you added, make a backup of the error free client.java somewhere and then try again

Read full topic
